title: Gnomes-War
subtitle: Own project
description: 'Gnomes War' is a rock-paper-scissors game implemented using HTML, SCSS, and JavaScript. The web leverages emojis for the elements‚ÄîüçÉ (plant), üî• (fire), and üíß (water)‚Äîto create an engaging user interface. The game logic utilizes random number generation to simulate the computer's choices, ensuring a varied gameplay experience. The design incorporates responsive styling for compatibility across devices.

title: Hangman
subtitle: Pair programming
description: This Hangman application is built using React and leverages RESTful APIs to fetch words dynamically for gameplay. The project features a clean, modular architecture with component-based design, ensuring maintainability. Multiplayer capabilities are implemented through socket.io for real-time interaction, allowing users to challenge friends while the single-player mode provides an intuitive and engaging experience.

title: Owen Wilson's WOW
subtitle: Individual project in Adalab
description: This project utilizes React to create a search engine for movies featuring Owen Wilson, leveraging a public REST API for movie data retrieval. The application includes state management using hooks to manage user input and display results dynamically. CSS is used for styling, ensuring a responsive design that enhances user experience across different devices.

title: SeriesFavoritas
subtitle: Individual project in Adalab
description: This web application allows users to manage their favorite TV series using a RESTful API for data handling. Implemented with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, it features search functionality, user authentication, and a favorites management system. The application utilizes local storage for maintaining user preferences and includes a user-friendly interface for adding or removing series.

title: Awesome-Cards
subtitle: Group project
tecnologies: HTML, CSS, SCSS, JS, API, Postman
description: The 'Awesome-Cards' project enables users to create personalized cards and share them on Twitter. Built with HTML, CSS, and SCSS for styling, it utilizes JavaScript for client-side logic and API calls to manage card data. The project emphasizes a responsive layout and leverages Postman for API testing, ensuring seamless user experience and data management.

title: Whack-a-Mario
subtitle: First own project
description: In 'Whack-a-Mario', the classic Whack-a-Mole game is reimagined using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The game features dynamic elements that respond to user interaction, with animations created using CSS transitions. The project focuses on DOM manipulation to manage game state, including score tracking and timing for game sessions, providing an engaging and interactive user experience.

title: Amen-Ramen
subtitle: Own proyect
description: E-commerce platform for an Asian restaurant, where users can browse various dishes, add them to the cart, and complete the purchase. The website is fully responsive and incorporates modern UI elements to enhance user experience. Features include dynamic search, filtering, and the ability to customize orders.

title: Cards Maker
subtitle: Group project
tecnologies: html, css, JS, React, NodeJs, MySQL
description: A collaborative project where users can create personalized cards to showcase their projects. Users can input details like project titles, descriptions, and technologies used, which will then be formatted into a stylish and customizable card. The app saves user data using MySQL, making the cards shareable and accessible online
